intro: Eusteralis stellata, commonly known as the starry eusteralis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Eusteralis stellata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for gardeners interested in native flora.
